Hi, I’m **Tanay Kasyap**—an incoming PhD student in Economics at [London Business School](https://www.london.edu/).  
My research interests are **industrial organization**, **contract theory**, and **labor economics** (with a focus on **time use**).

Previously, I was a pre-doctoral research fellow at Yale’s Tobin Center and Economic Growth Center, working with
[Samuel Kortum](https://economics.yale.edu/people/samuel-kortum) and
[Nicholas Ryan](https://economics.yale.edu/people/nicholas-ryan) on international trade and
dynamic industrial organization with an emphasis on energy markets.

Pre-doc projects analyzed **optimal unilateral carbon policy** and **structural change under climate shocks to agriculture** (with [Samuel Kortum](https://economics.yale.edu/people/samuel-kortum)),
and a **dynamic entry game** for energy firms connecting to the [California ISO (CAISO)](https://www.caiso.com/) (with [Nicholas Ryan](https://economics.yale.edu/people/nicholas-ryan)).
